stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes how ocean acidification harms coral reefs?
choicesHtml: Acidification increases the level of phosphorus in the water surrounding the reefs, which decreases growth rates of the algae that inhabit the reef.
Acidification attracts harmful invasive species to the reefs, which destroys the living components of the reef.
Acidification causes a dramatic increase in the rates of primary productivity, which releases excess CO2 and leads to a negative feedback loop.
Acidification decreases the amount of carbonate ions, which leads to a decline in the formation of reef infrastructure.
